message:
I had doubts about the accuracy of the TeamViewer hack news that spread out this week, it had no real reliable source beside the company denied it and the fact it was timed with major passwords breach all play in favor of the doubt 

Usually when a company get breached and user accounts stolen what the hackers do is offering to sell the accounts in black market which we did not see in this case 

Nothing can be certain and because of how critical to security running a compromised TeamViewer service could be people have every right to panic, i myself stopped the TeamViewer service on any critical machine i had ( better safe than sorry ) but as it been couple of days now with no further updates i wonder if it would be safe to use the service again now
story: Mohamed Abdel Aty shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Security Sense: Think Carefully Before Claiming a Company was Hacked
caption: windowsitpro.com
description: We've seen a lot of companies genuinely hacked lately and a lot of false claims too. It's really important to get the facts straight.

data.message: Man, two days ago at 12 AM exactly the website was pointing to a Chinese DNS! :D
